objects.name: PauseInfo
objects.string:
Navigate the pause menu using the 'UP'/'DOWN' arrows
Press 'ENTER' to select options

events.comment:
Variables meaning:

topY: The top position where there's the topmost platform
platformDistance: The distance between created platforms
randomPlatformDistance: A small random offset to add to the distance
If player steps on a new platform, add score and flag the platform as "used" to not give scores anymore

first time to run the tutorial
firstPlay is a global variable with a starting value of 1
Show the first tips (controls)
Each time the player is over a new platform, deactivate the previous tips and show the next ones
In the last step flag the tutorial as complete setting the firstPlay global variable to 0, reset the scene since now won't launch the tutorial again
Movement
Movement
Attack
Killing Enemies
Attack finished
Collision And Taking Damage
Damaging And KillingMobs
Demon Spawn and Follow
Dead

The camera top border is over the last platform position, create a new platform above and update the top platform limit
Also set a random value between 1 and 100 to decide if a spring must be created
Delete platforms totally outside the camera view (plus player height so the player can stand in the edge a bit more)
Controls to pause only works while the game is running
Keyboard controls, switch the pause variable (0 to 1, or 1 to 0)
Game over events run only on game over/game not running

This event and its sub-events will run a single time on game over
Delete the player (but leave the sprite), show the game over layer and update the final score text
If the new score is higher than the best score, update the best score and show the new record text
Update the best score text
Reset button clicked or touched, reset the scene
Game over events run only on game over/game not running

objects.name: playercontrols2
objects.string:
> Press the 'Left' and 'Right' arrows keys to move the player left and right
> Press the 'Up' arrow key once to jump, press again to double jump
> Press the 'x' key to swing your sword and attack enemies
> Press the 'p' key to pause the game
> Press the 'k' key to view the developer mode (FPS, Object Count, Total Time Played)

objects.name: playertips2
objects.string:
> Health can be restored by collecting the red health potions.
> There are three enemy types: Skeletons, Ghosts and the fearsome Demon!
> Earn points by jumping on new platforms and collecting coins.
> Be careful when you earn a lot of points! The Demon will chase and try catch you! Run! 
> Difficulty can be changed in the Settings page. Difficulty effects enemy spawn chance, speed of the demon and distance the between platforms.

objects.name: playertips
objects.string:
> Health can be restored by collecting the red health potions.
> There are three enemy types: Skeletons (2 points), Ghosts (5 points) and the fearsome Demon! 
> Earn points by jumping on new platforms and collecting coins.
> Be careful when you earn a lot of points! The Demon will chase and try catch you! Run! 
> The Demon fires skulls that chase you and will freeze you for a short while! Don't get caught!
> Difficulty can be changed in the Settings page. Difficulty effects enemy spawn chance and speed of the demon.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
After adding this to an object, you have to **trigger the effect** by using the **Flash action**.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Flash
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Flash

eventsFunctions.description: Make the specified object(s) blink for the given duration.
eventsFunctions.name: Flash

parameters.description: Duration of the blinking, in seconds
parameters.name: FlashDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the specified objects are flashing.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFlashing

eventsFunctions.description: Stop the flashing of the specified object
eventsFunctions.name: Stop

propertyDescriptors.label: Half period (time during which object is invisible), in seconds
propertyDescriptors.name: HalfPeriodTime

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Add actions and conditions to manage the life of the object. Object can get damages, lose some health and you can check with a condition if it's dead.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Health (life points and damages for objects)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add actions and conditions to manage the life of the object. Object can get damages, lose some health and you can check with a condition if it's dead.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Add actions and conditions to manage the life of the object. Object can get damages, lose some health and you can check with a condition if it's dead.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Health

eventsFunctions.description: Add some damage to the object, decreasing its life.
eventsFunctions.name: Hit

parameters.description: Value of the damage to do (will be removed from object health)
parameters.name: DamageValue

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is considered dead (no more health)
eventsFunctions.name: IsDead

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object was just damaged previously in the events.
eventsFunctions.name: IsJustDamaged

eventsFunctions.description: Heal the object, incrasing its life.
eventsFunctions.name: Heal

parameters.description: How much to heal (will be added to object health)
parameters.name: HealValue

eventsFunctions.description: Change the object health to set it to a specific value (check if the actions to damage or heal the object are not better suited to your use case before using this one).
eventsFunctions.name: SetHealth

propertyDescriptors.label: Damage cooldown (in seconds) (0 for no cooldown)
propertyDescriptors.name: DamageCooldown

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Gruk
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This behavior moves an object (like an enemy) for a chosen time or distance, then flips it and starts over, moving the object back and forth, vertically or horizontally.

Note: animations should be facing **Left** (for horizontal) or **Down** (for vertical) direction.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: TimedBackAndForthMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This behavior moves an object (like an enemy) for a chosen time or distance, then flips it and starts over, moving the object back and forth, vertically or horizontally.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Move an object (e.g. enemy) for a chosen time or distance, then flip it and start over. 
Note: animations should be facing LEFT.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: TimedBackAndForthMirroredMovement

events.comment: vertical mode
horizontal mode

propertyDescriptors.label: Move the object vertically (instead of horizontally)
propertyDescriptors.name: Vertical

propertyDescriptors.label: position of the sprite at the previous frame
propertyDescriptors.name: LastPosition
